text: <@U0YK3KKCY> before we submit changes, we should get the 390 machines running. Well, not necessarily, but it would help. <@U11HH3P7Y> was testing it via a build in sandbox. Do you mind helping him fix it? It keeps on hanging for some reason. I started investigating, network times out halfway through `apt-get`. When I run by hand, I did see that, but a lot more rarely. `docker logs` was my friend

It might be a host machine issue, in which case you might need ideas from Steven LaFalce <@U2G1Y9Q8P> . He might like help from you too... we were investigating my docker-compose instructions here: <https://github.com/vpaprots/fabric-images/blob/master/docs/LinuxONE.md> . For some reason, you need to reboot the machine, when it was freshly allocated, after starting `docker daemon`.

attachments.title: vpaprots/fabric-images
attachments.text: fabric-images - Docker images and Docker Compose files for running the Hyperledger fabric

text: (away at WoW Mon-Wed, will be slow answering)

<@U2G1Y9Q8P> <@U0YK3KKCY> Actually.. you might both want to compare notes, you both have written instructions how to bring up blockchain up on z. This might also be the right place to link to <https://hub.docker.com/r/sinenomine/> Neale Ferguson from Sinenomine single-handedly maintains  CentOS on z (calls it ClefOS) and built hyperledger fabric images on z. You might know him as brunswickheads here <https://hub.docker.com/r/brunswickheads/openchain-peer/>
We spent several weeks exchanging build advice on z, while I was working on my patches..
